stories.content: While walking down the street with two German friends, we were stopped by a fundraiser. However, he only addressed my friends, making eye contact with them alone, and in the end, only had them sign up, completely skipping over me. What, do I look like I can’t understand people, or like I'm invisible, or do I look like someone who should be receiving donations instead? I felt shocked, confused, and disappointed, especially since my German friends acted like it was no big deal, which hurt me even more.

At the grocery store near my home, the cashier would always joke and laugh with German customers, but his expression changed when he got to me. Once, when I told him I didn’t need a receipt as usual, he replied, “Of course, you don’t.” That was when I realized he was targeting me, and it felt extremely uncomfortable. After that, I never went back to that store, opting to walk ten minutes longer to a place with a self-checkout.

When I got home, two young people came out of the elevator, paused when they saw me, made an 'Asian prayer' gesture, and squeezed by me with a sneer as they exited. I was just returning home and encountered people who picked a fight for no reason, making me feel depressed and immediately lose my sense of belonging in my own building.
